metadata.title: CVE-2016-4053 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Squid 3.x before 3.5.17 and 4.x before 4.0.9 allow remote attackers toobtain sensitive stack layout information via crafted Edge Side Includes(ESI) responses, related to incorrect use of assert and compileroptimization.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4053` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squid-cgi - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squid-common - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squid-purge - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squid3 - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squidclient - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2').
